question: What son of Aethlius and Calyce, known as the 'sleeping beauty' of Greek mythology, was prominently featured on Roman sarcophagi?

answer: 'I do not love you, Sabidius; I cannot say why. I am only able to say this: I do not love you.'

Translate the sentence 'Servi coxerunt cenam ne magister illos verberaret.' into English.
answer: The slaves cooked dinner so that their master would not beat them.

question: Translate the sentence 'Timeo ne mei servi me occidere temptent.' into English.
answer: I fear that my slaves may try to kill me.

question: Translate the sentence 'Magister cucurrit quo celerius servos evitaret.' into English.
answer: The master fled to more quickly avoid the slaves.

question: What were Ennius' three hearts?

answer: If she had won, she would have been happy.

question: What is this man saying: 'Potesne me docere quomodo dugias?' Assuming the verb 'dugio, dugere' means 'to dougie.'
answer: Can you teach me how to dougie?

question: Upon teaching this man your sweet 'dougie-ing' skills a woman comments: 'Habes motūs tamquam es Iagger.' What is this woman saying?
Perform the following command: 'Nunc demonstrate, vos omnes, spectatoribus tuos dulces motus (long u) saltando.'
answer: All the players should show the spectators their sweet dance moves by dancing.

question: Perform the following command: 'Sta, age ad sinistrum, age retro, deinde sali semel.'
answer: The student should get up, go to the left, go backwards, and jump once.

question: Perform the following command: 'Nunc omnes ostendete dextros, deinde illos retrahite, deinde ostendete pedes sinistros, deinde illos retrahite.'
answer: The team should extend their right hands, retract their right hands, extend their left feet, then retract their left feet.

question: Perform the following command: 'Agite tamquam togae tuae ardeant!'
answer: The team should act as though their togas were on fire.

You are traveling on a spaceship in the farthest frontiers of space. Your ship gets sucked into a black hole, and you are not teleported forward in time, where the Earth is ruled by primates, but back in time - to the glory days of Rome. How would you say, in Latin, 'Take me to your leader'?
answer: Duce / Ducite me ad ducem tuum / vestrum (imp. mood necessary)

question: Now that they've taken you to their leader, Caligula, you sit down with him in the triclinium and discuss his military campaigns. Trying to curry favor with him, you want to compliment his victories. How would you say, in Latin, 'These armies, which are the best of all, are invincible.'
answer: Hi exercitus, qui optimi omnium sunt, invicti sunt

question: After leaving Caligula's company and journeying through the forum, a disheveled old man with a wild beard comes chasing after you - pursuing you through every street and yelling feverishly 'Cave! Spectavi te cadentem e caelo, simulac magnum sonitum audivi! Imperator vult te interficere, quod cogitat te deum esse!' According to the old man, why does the emperor want to kill you?
answer: He thinks you are a god

question: Before they ever fought against each other, the Romans and Carthaginians had been allies. In what year did Rome and Carthage sign their first treaty?

answer: Rome allowed Carthage to recruit mercenaries from Italy

question: A medication has the abbreviation H.S. on it. According to this abbreviation, when should this medication be taken?

question: When should a medication be taken if it has the abbreviation A.C. written on it?

Differentiate in meaning between the verbs 'miror' and 'minor.'

According to some versions, what brother of Demophon was Phyllis' husband, the recipient of the box?

After Acamas married Phyllis, he sailed away, but promised to return. Phyllis gave him the box as he departed, instructing him to only open it if he decided that he wasn't going to come back after all. Well, as mythological men were wont to do, Acamas forgot all about his wife and settled happily on Cyprus. After some time, he opened the box and went insane upon seeing its contents. He tried to escape the horrors, but as he was galloping away on his horse, he met a tragic death. What exactly happened to him?
answer: He fell on his own sword

Bob has 3 apples, and Jane has 6 apples. Jane says, 'Dabo patri omnia mala mea.' Bob, upset that Jane will upstage him yet again, replies, 'Oh yeah? Well, dabo patri omnia mala mea et tua!' Are there any grammatical errors in Bob's Latin?

Jane, always ready to show off her own Latin knowledge, says 'Ha-ha! Sum melior te non solum numerante malis sed etiam dicente linguam Latinam.' What grammatical error in Latin, if any, has Jane made now?
answer: She uses the abl. pl. of 'malum' instead of the acc. pl.

question: Their father, hearing the argument, comes outside and shouts 'Do you kids ever get along?' If Bob translates this phrase into Latin in his head, he comes up with 'Cooperatis, liberi, umquam?' What grammatical error in Latin, if any, has Bob made?
answer: He forgot to add the enclitic 'ne' to the verb 'cooperatis'
